Description: Large leather fragment of a document which has been folded several times and which contains Old Nubian writing on the inner surface. The exterior surface is reddish-brown while the interior is rust coloured. The edges are ragged. Though largely illegible, the document has been identified as a legal text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2 A1, Room 1-5, fill - discovered in refuse deposit
Bibliographic references: Adams & Adams 1998 / Kulubnarti II, The Artifactual Remains (p.87, 129)
Browne 2000 / An Old Nubian Document from Kulubnarti
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.2.749 (excavation object cat. no.)
